equipped.name: (a nice warm pair of winter boots)

mobs.keywords: dragon white huge Tri Aszp Tri-Aszp
mobs.long_desc: A huge white dragon is resting in the frigid waters of the pool.
mobs.desc: This venerable white dragon, measuring well over 75 feet from head to tail, is known as Tri-Aszp.  She is begining to show her age, and bears a few unmended scars on her wings.  A few of her scales have also been torn from her enormous body, and a few of her claws have been broken.  Tri-Aszp seems calm and relaxed, and has a smug look of confidence pasted across her face.  She has a row of horns atop her head that only add to her tired, demented grin.

mobs.long_desc: A small white dragon hisses venomously.
mobs.desc: This small white dragon squirms around the floor, exploring its surroundings. At the moment it is no larger than a giant dog, but over the years it will grow into a huge beast much like it's mother.  It must have just recently been born, as it's scales are unhardened and still clear in color, with the lightest hint of their future bright white.  It seems to have the munchies, and snaps viciously at anything that moves.

mobs.long_desc: A large worm-like creature with multiple legs rears up as if ready to strike.
mobs.desc: Also known as a Polar Worm, the Remorhaz has a long worm like body measuring thirty feet long.  Multiple legs run down its body and when it attacks it raises up the front quarter of its body, which possesses no legs.  Small wing-like extremities flank either side of this front quarter.  The Remorhaz has large insect-like eyes, and sharp fangs can be seen in its mouth.  The light blue coloring on the creature seems to change shades periodically.

mobs.keywords: ice-golem golem ice tall humanoid jagged
mobs.long_desc: A tall humanoid made of ice glares around with glowing eyes.
mobs.desc: This huge magically-created creature is made entirely of ice.  It looks as if large chunks of frozen water were thrown together in the creation process. Its arms are of different lengths, and its head is jagged and lopsided, leaning to the left.  It would almost seem that the creator of this ice golem failed, causing this utterly deformed being.  The ice golem's glowing eyes follow even the slightest movement around the room.

mobs.long_desc: A huge human with long flowing blond hair stares around.
mobs.desc: The huge humanoid here is a Frost Giant.  They are a rare breed of giants that inhabit only the coldest of regions.  He looks much like a large viking, especially with the thick double-horned helm atop his head.  The Frost Giant has a long yellow beard and flowing blond hair.  His eyes are narrow and his skin has a pale, ivory coloring to it, causing the blue of his veins to stand out quite prominantly.

mobs.long_desc: A spherical creature with a large eye and many eye stalks floats here.
mobs.desc: This large globular creature floats a few feet off of the ground.  It has a hard chitinous covering that protects the softer body below.  Attached to the top of the sphere are ten eye stalks, while in the middle there is a large eleventh eye, and a large mouth with sharp, pointed teeth.

mobs.long_desc: A large humanoid covered in white fur growls and looks around.
mobs.desc: This huge creature looks like some strange combination of human and polar bear. Its body is covered in thick white fur, and it walks upright.  It has pale blue eyes and a huge hand with sharp claws.  It does not look too bright, as it raises its head and looks around blankly at any sound.

mobs.long_desc: A small glowing blue orb darts about rapidly in an erratic manner.
mobs.desc: This glowing sphere could be mistaken for a lantern or torch from a distance. It darts about at high speed and in a completely random manner.  The intensity of the light changes from very bright to quite dim.  The will-o-wisp also shifts in color from blue to violet to green and back again.

mobs.long_desc: A young man dressed in light white robes stands here studying.
mobs.desc: This young mage's name is Aelfric.  He has a pale yet handsome face and slightly pointed ears.  It is apparent that he is not human, but rather an elven breed known commonly as the Frost Elves.  His eyes twinkle with some kind of intense knowledge.  The robes he wears are a plain white color, with a sewn patch of red in the shape of a dragon claw over his heart.

mobs.long_desc: A young woman with marvelous hair sweeps her eyes around.
mobs.desc: Some how this youthful woman is recognizable as Sorcha; the newly risen leader of the Cult of Tri-Aszp.  She has lead this hideous cult, dedicated to the huge white dragon for a long enough time that her name is known well by locals. Sorcha is graced by beauty and has a heart colder than the ice which surrounds her.  Her robes are pale and blue like the sky, and nicely highlights her rich auburn hair and blue eyes.  She looks to be in search of a sacrifice to place on her altar.

mobs.long_desc: A young man with pale blue eyes tilts his head up and looks around.
mobs.desc: This man wears the clothing showing that he is totally devoted to Sorcha and to the worship of Tri-Aszp.  There is malevolence apparent in his dark blue eyes. He is slightly hunched over and tilts his head in the direction of any noises or other disturbances to him.

mobs.long_desc: A battle-scarred warrior straightens himself and prepares for a fight.
mobs.desc: This veteran of many battles now stands as a guard for the Cult of Tri-Aszp. He has a keen eye, and watches everything around him carefully.  He is tall and heavily built.  He almost lazily prepares himself, not wanting to be bothered with having to fight at the moment.

mobs.long_desc: A huge humanoid, made of smooth ice, glares menacingly about.
mobs.desc: This mammoth creature is composed entirely of ice.  Roughly humanoid in shape, it is native to the elemental plane of ice.  There is a slight red tint to the creatures inner glow, but it seems to be due to some curious red film on the creatures body.

mobs.keywords: ice-elemental-lord lord elemental ice monstrous being ice-lord
mobs.long_desc: A monstrous being made entirely from ice towers high into the air.
mobs.desc: This giant creature is composed of ice, and towers high above any normal man. There is some interesting glow within the creature, and there seems also to be a strange power pulsing from within.

mobs.long_desc: A giant wolf covered in thick fur narrows his eyes and growls.
mobs.desc: This giant wolf is the size of a small horse.  Its long, thick, plush coat is glistening white, with streaks of silver throughout.  Winter wolves leave rather large tracks in normal terrain, but in the ice, only the large claws extending from each foot leaves a mark.

mobs.long_desc: A giant wolf covered in thick fur narrows his eyes and growls.
mobs.desc: A giant wolf covered in thick fur narrows his eyes and growls.  Desc: This giant wolf is the size of a small horse.  Its long, thick, plush coat is glistening white, with streaks of silver throughout.  Winter wolves leave rather large tracks in normal terrain, but in the ice, only the large claws extending from each foot leaves a mark.

mobs.long_desc: A stalwart man recites incantations near the western wall.
mobs.desc: This burly man, wrapped in heavy furs, eyes shielded behind thick snow goggles, labors away at the cavern wall.  He methodically heaves a heavy block of ice into place along the tunnel floor, strikes it with a pickaxe, then recites an incantation, causing the ice to fuse with the tunnel's surface.

objects.ground: A small key made of jade lies here.

extras.text: This key is carved of strong, valueable green jade.

objects.ground: A large key made entirely of ice lies on the ground.

extras.text: This key appears to made of some sort of magically strengthened ice that doesn't melt.

objects.ground: A key made of a translucent material lies on the ground.

extras.text: It is possible to see completely through this key, though it is not made from plastic or ice or glass.  It could be magical.

objects.ground: A key with the head shaped like a white dragon is here.

extras.text: This large key is shaped like a dragon, its eye glowing red.

objects.ground: A large key made of a strange white metal lies here.

extras.text: This is a flimsey bit of metal, shaped like a key to something.

objects.ground: A mace carved to look like a dragon's fist lies here.

extras.text: This mace is made of shiny metal similar to steel only much lighter.  The head of the mace is ornately carved to look like a curled dragon's claw. The detail and workmanship are outstanding.

objects.ground: An oaken staff with the head of dragon's claw rests here.

extras.text: This thin wooden staff is made of deep rich oak.  A cap made of silver protects the base of the stick.  At its head is a small dragon's claw that clutches a sapphire stone made of the richest blue you have ever seen.  An aura of power surrounds the staff.

objects.ground: A white robe with a red dragon's claw lies crumpled here.

extras.text: This white robe has the image of a red bleeding dragon's claw positioned over the left breast.  This is the symbol of the cult of Tri-Aszp.

objects.ground: A dagger made of hardened ice lies forgotten on the floor.

extras.text: This dagger is made of a magically hardened ice that is called ice-steel because it takes on the strength of steel.  Besides being composed entirely of ice it is a fairly unremarkable dagger.

objects.ground: A breastplate made of magical, hardened ice rests here.

extras.text: This breastplate is made of a magically hardened ice called ice-steel because it takes on the strength of steel.  It is as light as ice and has hard as steel.  Embossed on the surface of the breastplate in a strange red ice is the symbol of the cult of Tri-Aszp: a bleeding dragon's claw.

objects.ground: A set of leggings made of magical, hardened ice lies here.

extras.text: These leggings are made of a magically hardened ice called ice-steel. Ice-steel is as hard as steel and weights as much as ice.  On the thigh of each leg is an image embossed in a strange red ice.  The image is the symbol of the cult of Tri-Aszp: a bleeding dragon's claw

objects.ground: A large white dragon's egg lies in the snow.

extras.text: As you look at the large white dragon's egg you seem to remember something you heard a long time ago.  Something about how a dragon's egg had some special power.  If only you could remember what it was...

objects.ground: A huge gleaming axe rests on the ground.

extras.text: This giant axe is taller than a man, only someone with great strength could have any hope of wielding it.

objects.ground: A giant club made from the bone of a dragon lies here.

extras.text: This is a typical bone club used by yeti's of the arctic region.  It is fashioned from a large dragon's bone and is highly decorated with strange carvings.

objects.ground: A gleaming heart made of pure ice lies here.

extras.text: This heart is made of gleaming ice and contains the essence that helped tie the elemental to this plane.  It is rumored to bestow great powers to anyone who wear it around their neck on a chain made of gold.  However such rumors are not always true...

objects.ground: A shield with the image of a dragon's claw lies here.

extras.text: This white heater-shaped shield bears the symbol of the cult of Tri-Aszp on its front: a bleeding dragon's claw.  You notice that it is extremely well balanced.

objects.ground: A helm made out of the jaw of a dragon rests here.

extras.text: This helm is constructed out of the jaw of dragon.  A metal skull cap is attached to the jaw to protect the top of the head while the jaw protects the side and back of the head.

objects.ground: A silver amulet embedded with a dragon's eye lies here.

extras.text: This amulet is made of pure silver and in its center is embedded the huge eye of a dragon.  A gold chain allows it it be worn around the neck.

objects.ground: A flowing white gown made of silk lies forgotten here.

extras.text: This gown is the ceremonial clothing traditionally worn by the high- priestess of the cult of Tri-Aszp.

objects.ground: Ice cold water flows from a slender crystal fountain.

extras.text: The fountain is essentially a low circular wall that contains a small pool of ice-cold water.  In the center of the pool - rising out of it - is a small dragon, its head raised toward the sky.  Water gently flows out of its open mouth.  Considering the temperature in this cavern you are amazed that the water has not frozen.  A plaque affixed to the base of the fountain reads, "Water Bringeth Life."

objects.ground: A large white dragon's egg lies in the snow.

extras.text: As you look at the large white dragon's egg you seem to remember something you heard a long time ago.  Something about how a dragon's egg had some special power.  If only you could remember what it was...

objects.ground: An ice-encrusted signpost is staked into the ground here.

extras.text: This sign is jammed into the hard ground and looks to be frozen. It reads: Lowly traveler, many a strong man and woman have taken to exploring these tunnels, and few have returned as they entered. The tunnel to the south leads to the ruthless horde known as the Dragon Cult.  The tunnels west lead to a large section of land known local people as Frost Valley. From those who have lost loved ones, we wish you a safe journey, and hope that you are able to avenge the deaths of those who have traveled before you.

objects.ground: A box is fitted into the wall of ice.

extras.text: This case is held closed by a small lock.  There seems to be ice covering some of the joints, making it difficult to open.

The box is made of extremely hard wood that has been weathered.  It looks much like a case which might be carried, except is now fixed into the wall, hopelessly stuck in the grip of the ice.  Inspecting the case closely reveals a small lock in the side of it.  There is a strange shimmer coming from the inside which definately comes from something else being present, but it would take a dragon's eye to see for certain while the case is closed.

objects.ground: A large white dragon's egg lies in the snow.

extras.text: As you look at the large white dragon's egg, you seem to remember something you heard long ago.  Something about how a dragon's egg had special powers.  Now what was that.

objects.ground: The cover of a shield lies here.

extras.text: This cover is holding a wonderful object, albeit hard to get at through the hard casing it is in.

objects.ground: A perfect white dragon scale lies here.

extras.text: About as large as a human's palm, this pure white scale comes from the tender shoulder area of a white dragon.  It is a beautiful scale, shining brightly in the light and feeling slightly cool to the touch.  Dragons are very magical creatures, so the scale would probably be valuable to a researching sorcerer or anyone else interested in unlocking the power of a dragon's skin.

objects.ground: Paper covered in icy blue notes has been tacked down nearby.

extras.text: Written across this finely milled sheet of paper in icy blue runes is an incantation to create a block of living ice.  The spell captures and focuses the animating energies of ice elementals into a section of the elemental's body.

objects.ground: A large block of ice has been left here.

extras.text: You see a perfectly square block of ice.  White veins and cracks criss cross through the block, giving it a marbled appearance.  It seems to absorb all heat and remain perfectly frozen no matter the temperature around it.  You could swear it squirms when you reach out to touch it!

triggers.name: hatching_dragon
triggers.commands: return 0 osend %actor% As you touch the egg it vibrates and cracks open! oechoaround %actor% As %actor.name% touches the egg it hatches! oload mob 53301 oforce dragon consider %actor.name% oforce dragon hit %actor.name% opurge %self.name%

triggers.name: sorcha_greet
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 gasp say You dare to approach the altar of the mighty Tri-Aszp?! emote prays silently for a few seconds to her overlord. endif

triggers.name: triaszp_helpers
triggers.commands: wait 1s set value %random.10% switch %value% case 1 breath frost break case 2 case 3 sweep break case 4 case 5 roar break case 8 case 9 if %get.mob_count[53301]% < 6 set victim %random.char% emote hisses in anger, calling to her children. wait 1s mload mob 53301 mforce baby-dragon emote scampers in and attacks! if %victim.vnum% == -1 mforce baby-dragon kill %victim.name% else mforce baby-dragon kill %actor.name% endif endif break default growl done

triggers.name: reload_helpers
triggers.commands: wait 1s set value %random.10% if %value% < 2 emote roars in pain and tries to locate more children. wait 1s if %get.mob_count[53301]% < 6 mload mob 53301 mforce baby-dragon emote scampers in and attacks! mforce baby-dragon kill %actor.name% endif endif

triggers.name: reload_helpers_2
triggers.commands: emote looks worried and tries to find some more children. set loaded 0 global loaded

triggers.name: frost_valley_entrance
triggers.commands: wdoor 53302 west room 53401 wdoor 53302 west description The piles of ice slips allowing passage. wdoor 53302 west name ice wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% pushes some ice out of the way, opening a passage down the western tunnel. wsend %actor% It took some effort, but the wall of ice has been moved from the west, allowing passage. wat 53401 wecho The ice falls from the east allowing passage. wait 1 t wecho The ice seems to magically reform blocking the western passage. wdoor 53302 west purge

triggers.name: wolf pack
triggers.commands: set room %self.room% mgoto 1100 mload mob 53315 mforce wolf follow 2.wolf mteleport wolf %room% mload mob 53315 mforce wolf follow 2.wolf mteleport wolf %room% mload mob 53315 mforce wolf follow 2.wolf mteleport wolf %room% mgoto %room%

triggers.name: wall_ice_sculptor_greet
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 mecho %self.name% says, 'I see you're crafting something.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' quest variable %type%_wand %actor% greet 1 else say Do you have what I need for the wand? endif wait 1s endif endif set stage %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% if %stage% == 0 if %actor.class% /= Cryomancer && %actor.level% > 56 wave say Hey, you there, you look like a capable cryomancer!  Lend me a hand with this wall, will ya? wait 2s say We had a few nasty surprises with creatures slipping out from Frost Valley.  So Suralla sent me over to reinforce the wall blocking off the tunnel. wait 2s say I ran out of supplies and my spells can't make permanent walls.  Can you help me get more ice for the wall? endif elseif %stage% == 1 eval ice (20 - %actor.quest_variable[wall_ice:blocks]%) if %ice% > 1 say Do you have the %ice% remaining blocks of ice? elseif %ice% == 1 say Do you have the last remaining block of ice? endif endif

triggers.name: ice_wall_sculptor_speech
triggers.argument_list: Yes okay wall? How? Ice? supplies? ice supplies how
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% == 0 if %actor.class% /= Cryomancer && %actor.level% > 56 quest start wall_ice %actor.name% if %actor.sex% == female say Thank you so much ma'am! elseif %actor.sex% == male say Thank you so much sir! else say Thank you so much! endif wait 1s say What I need are blocks of living ice.  Using Wall of Ice I can fuse them together so they make a permanent barrier.  I chewed through my stock pile of living ice faster than I anticipated, so I need more. wait 2s emote writes some notes down on a piece of paper. mload obj 53326 give notes %actor.name% wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'This spell has a chance to capture animated energies of ice creatures in their remains.  Have the spell on you and say &6&b'crystalize'&0 in the presence of an ice creature before you defeat it.' wait 4s say The more powerful the creature, the more likely this spell will create a block of living ice from it.  But be careful, it only works on creatures actually made of ice!! wait 4s say Though there are a number of ice creatures in Frost Valley, any ice creature is fine.  I need 20 more blocks to finish this wall. wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'You can check your &7&b[spell progress]&0 at any time.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% == 1 say Hand 'em on over then! endif endif

triggers.name: wall_ice_crystalize_speech
triggers.commands: set drop %actor.quest_variable[wall_ice:drop]% if %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% == 1 && %actor.inventory[53326]% && %self.vnum% != 53316 if %ice% msend %actor% &6You have already cast this spell on %self.name%!&0 else set ice %random.100% if %drop% < 21 if %ice% <= %self.level% mecho &6A dark glow surrounds &6&b%self.name%&0&6 briefly!&0 set ice 1 global ice eval count (%drop% + 1) quest variable wall_ice %actor.name% drop %count% else mecho &6The spell seems to have no effect!&0 set ice 2 global ice endif endif endif elseif %self.vnum% == 53316 && %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% == 2 && %actor.inventory[53326]% mecho &6&bThe blocks of living ice slowly fuse together!&0 wait 1s say Well done! nod %actor.name% wait 1s say All in a good day's work! wait 1s say Keep the notes.  It should be everything you need to cast Wall of Ice yourself. msend %actor.name% &6&bYou have learned Wall of Ice!&0 quest complete wall_ice %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% wall of ice endif

triggers.name: wall_ice_sculptor_receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% == 1 wait 2 eval ice %actor.quest_variable[wall_ice:blocks]% + 1 quest variable wall_ice %actor.name% blocks %ice% say Great, this is exactly what I need! mecho %self.name% adds %object.shortdesc% to the wall blocking the tunnel. mjunk all.block-living-ice if %actor.quest_variable[wall_ice:blocks]% == 20 wait 1s quest advance wall_ice %actor.name% mecho %self.name% says, 'Excellent, this looks like enough ice!  Now all we have to do is cast the spell.  If you'd like to do the honors, just command the ice to &6&bcrystalize&0.' else wait 2 say Got any more? endif else wait 2 mjunk all.block-living-ice say Hey thanks!  I could always use more of those. endif

triggers.name: spell progress
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% == 1 set have %actor.quest_variable[wall_ice:blocks]% eval need (20 - %have%) wait 2 say Let me see... mecho %self.name% counts the number of blocks. wait 2s say You have brought me &6&b%have% blocks of living ice.&0 mecho say I still need &6&b%need%&0 more. mecho mecho %self.name% says, 'If you need a new copy of the spell of living ice, say "&6&bplease replace the spell&0".' elseif %actor.has_completed[wall_ice]% say We've already completed the repairs here.  Good work! elseif !%actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% say Did you want to help me work? endif

triggers.name: Sculptor refuse
triggers.commands: switch %object.vnum% case %wandgem% case %wandtask3% case %wandtask4% case %wandvnum% halt break default if %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% && %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% set response This won't help us build this wall and I can't craft with it. elseif %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% set response I can't craft with this. elseif %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% set response This won't help us build this wall. else set response What is this for? endif done if %response% return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 say %response% endif

triggers.name: wall_of_ice_spell_replacement
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[wall_ice]% say Oh sure.  But be careful.  Don't lose this spell again. mload obj 53326 give spell-living-ice %actor% endif

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This is a rough-hewn tunnel cut through the solid of this mountain.  It is freezing cold in here and a gusty wind blows from the west making strange howling noises as it races through the tunnel.  A strange dim light seems to be coming from deep within the ice.  It is light enough to see by, but is casts eerie shadows on the wall as it is reflected by the ice.  A layer of snow has been blown into the tunnel entrance by the last storm, and already there are many footprints heading west following the tunnel.

extras.text: The footprints on the floor of this tunnel head in both east and west.  You notice that there are quite a lot of them and they are definitely not human.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: Sloping slightly downward, travel along this rough-hewn passage is especially dangerous.  A freezing wind races from the north, and would numb even the most heavily cloaked warrior.  The tunnel leads north and south through the ice.  Something strange seems carved into the west wall.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali.  " Obviously it is in some strange language which is no doubt long vanished from use.

rooms.name: A T-Junction in the Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel through the ice comes to a T-Junction.  Passages lead off west, south and to the east.  There is still that dim light emanating from deep within the ice, illuminating this rough-hewn tunnel.  The passage to the west, however, is blocked by many large chunks of ice.  Perhaps pushing them will move them.

rooms.name: Rocky Cavern
rooms.description: This huge cavern has a floor and walls made of rough, uneven rock.  The upper parts of the wall and vaguely domed shaped ceiling are made of ice.  The walls here slope down abruptly, and the ceiling is somewhat low.  The cavern continues north and west.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously they are in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Ice Cavern
rooms.description: This cavern is spacious, and appears to have been magically carved into the ice.  There is a tunnel in the ice to the east and sharp bits of rock all about sticking out from the walls and floor.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously it is in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Ice Cavern
rooms.description: This cavern is spacious, and appears to have been magically carved into the ice.  There is a tunnel in the ice to the north and sharp bits of rock all about sticking out from the walls and floor.

rooms.name: Ice Cavern
rooms.description: This cavern is spacious, and appears to have been magically carved into the ice.  There is a tunnel in the ice to the west and sharp bits of rock all about sticking out from the walls and floor.

rooms.name: Ice Cavern
rooms.description: This cavern is spacious, and appears to have been magically carved into the ice.  There seems to have been a tunnel at one time to the south, but it has been long frozen over.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east into a large cavern, and north.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the north and south.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: T-Junction in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This section of the ice tunnel branches off in three directions.  To the north a distance is a large cavern, while there is nothing of specific interest to the west or south.  There are bits of rock and other pieces of junk scattered about the ground, but nothing of great value.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east and west.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously they are in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east and west.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

West.description: A stone wall with a solid oaken door bars any passage to the west. Through a small barred window set into the door you can make out a narrow staircase that descends deeper into the earth.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the north and south.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all. There is a slight rise in the tunnel to the north, leading into a large cavern.

rooms.name: Blue Slime Cavern
rooms.description: This cavern is huge, the walls are covered with a curious translucent blue slime which also oozes onto the floor.  There is a mess of half-eaten corpses lining the floor.  Mixed among the bodies are broken weapons and shields of all sorts.  There is a tunnel carved through the ice to the south, while the cavern and thick blue slime continues thicker to the north and east.

rooms.name: Blue Slime Cavern
rooms.description: This cavern is huge, the walls are covered with a curious translucent blue slime which also oozes onto the floor.  There is a mess of half-eaten corpses lining the floor.  Mixed among the bodies are broken weapons and shields of all sorts.  The cavern extends itself to the south where the slime seems less thick and also to the east.

rooms.name: Blue Slime Cavern
rooms.description: This cavern is huge, the walls are covered with a curious translucent blue slime which also oozes onto the floor.  There is a mess of half-eaten corpses lining the floor.  Mixed among the bodies are broken weapons and shields of all sorts.  There is an exit from this cavern to the north, back up the ice tunnel.

rooms.name: Blue Slime Cavern
rooms.description: This cavern is huge, the walls are covered with a curious translucent blue slime which also oozes onto the floor.  There is a mess of half-eaten corpses lining the floor.  Mixed among the bodies are broken swords and various dented plates or armor.  There is a tunnel east through the ice, while there is a fountain to the north inside the cavern.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This nearly perfectly circular tunnel rises slightly to the north where it comes to a bend.  To the south it opens into a larger cavern, allowing for some standing up.  The cavern is much brighter than the dimly lit tunnel.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel descends sharply at this point to the south, rising slightly to the east.  The strange light within the ice is dim here, barely bright enough to see by.  The tunnel continues east and south.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel descends sharply at this point to the west, rising slightly to the east.  The strange light within the ice is dim here, barely bright enough to see by.  The tunnel continues east and west.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously it is in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Rocky Tunnel
rooms.description: Unlike most of the other tunnels, this one is cut mostly through rock, leading back to ice tunnel to the east, or a very large cavern to the west. The walls are rough-hewn and have many jagged edges.  The light from the cavern to the west shines brightly into this section of tunnel.

rooms.name: Bend in Rocky Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the south and west.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Rocky Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the north and south.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: T-Junction in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues in three directions from here, north, east and west.  There is a bend in the tunnel visible to the west.  Other than a bit of rock here and there, the tunnel is empty, and even the blue light does not change or flicker as elsewhere in the tunnels.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east and south.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the north and south, leading into a large cavern.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east and west into a large cavern.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the north and west.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east and south to another bend.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east to a roomy cavern, and to the west.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Rocky Cavern
rooms.description: This huge cavern has a floor and walls made of rough, uneven rock.  The upper parts of the wall and vaguely domed shaped ceiling are made of ice.  The cavern continues south and east, and there is a stretch of tunnel through the ice to the west.

rooms.name: Rocky Cavern
rooms.description: This huge cavern has a floor and walls made of rough, uneven rock.  The upper parts of the wall and vaguely domed shaped ceiling are made of ice.  The cavern continues south and west, and there is circular ice tunnel to the north.

rooms.name: Rocky Cavern
rooms.description: This huge cavern has a floor and walls made of rough, uneven rock.  The upper parts of the wall and vaguely domed shaped ceiling are made of ice.  The cavern continues east to the largest section of the cavern, and also to the north.

rooms.name: Rocky Cavern
rooms.description: There is something suspicious lying in this room.  Small drips of water fall from the apex in the ceiling above, yet never land directly below where they fall.  It would almost seem as though there is something in the very center of the room, making it impossible for the water to drip there.  The center could almost reveal something on better inspection.  Otherwise, the cavern continues off in all directions.

rooms.name: Rocky Cavern
rooms.description: This huge cavern has a floor and walls made of rough, uneven rock.  The upper parts of the wall and vaguely domed shaped ceiling are made of ice.  The cavern continue north to the largest section, and to the east.

rooms.name: Rocky Cavern
rooms.description: This huge cavern has a floor and walls made of rough, uneven rock.  The upper parts of the wall and vaguely domed shaped ceiling are made of ice.  The cavern continues west to the largest section of cavern, and to the south.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the north to a bend and south to a roomy cavern.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the south and west.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east and west.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east and west.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously it is in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This long, plain tunnel carved in brilliant blue ice continues on to the east and west.  There is really nothing other than the occasional bit of rock here, and even the blue glowing light does not flicker or change at all. There does seem to be an intersection to the west.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously it is in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Stone Hallway
rooms.description: This stone hallway is lit by torches set in iron sconces.  The torch flames casting long shadows down the length of the hallway, which continues to the south and north.  To the south however, the tunnel is no longer made of stone, but instead is ice once again.

rooms.name: Stone Hallway
rooms.description: This stone hallway is lit by torches set in iron scones.  The torch flames casting long shadows down the length of the hallway, which continues to the south.  There is an oak doorway to the east of here.

East.description: An old oaken door with a small window is set into the this wall.  Through the small barred window you can see a large cavern made of ice that glows with a blue light.

rooms.name: Blue Ice Cavern
rooms.description: The floor and part of the west wall of this huge cavern is paved with stone bricks.  The remainder of the cavern is formed of a strange blue ice.  Because of the size of the cavern, the curious blue light coming from deep within the ice reflects all about.  There is a small tunnel to the north, which was cut into the ice.  The cavern continues south and east of here.  To the west is a small door.

West.description: An old oaken door with a small window is set into the cavern wall, that has been closed off with a stone wall.  Through the small barred window there is visible a stone hallway, leading off to the south.

rooms.name: Blue Ice Cavern
rooms.description: The entire floor of this cavern is paved over with large, flat stones.  The walls curve in towards the ceiling, making the cavern appear to be domed. Along the east wall, fitted into the ice, is a shelf holding several old books and tomes.  The cavern itself continues to the south and west.

extras.text: These shelves are stacked high with old books and tomes.  It is fitted nicely into the wall, and affords some protection to the books that it holds.

These books are quite old and begining to fade, all except one.  There is a dark colored text which stands out from the others.  Lettered in gold along the binding are is the title, it reads: The Text of Kzal.

The Text of Kzal is old, but still in fairly good condition.  The cover says: Only Kzal can live to continue on through the battle.  Kzal will survive, and triumph where all others will fall short.  The text is closed tight, held by some magical force that cannot seem to be broken.  Whatever it is, there is no apparent way to get a look at the insides of the mysterious book.

rooms.name: Blue Ice Cavern
rooms.description: The walls and ceiling of this large cavern are made of a strange blue ice, and the floor has been paved with large flat stones.  There is not much to this large section of the cavern, except for the blue light bouncing around from deep within the ice.

rooms.name: Blue Ice Cavern
rooms.description: This part of the cavern is simple.  There is nothing more than the flat stone bricks covering the ground, and the strange blue ice with their internal light.  The cavern continues north and west from here.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel descends sharply at this point to the south, rising slightly to the north.  The strange light within the ice is dim here, barely bright enough to see by.  The tunnel continues north and south.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously it is in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel descends sharply at this point to the west, rising slightly to the north.  The strange light within the ice is dim here, barely bright enough to see by.  The tunnel continues north and west.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel descends sharply at this point to the west, rising slightly to the east.  The strange light within the ice is dim here, barely bright enough to see by.  The tunnel continues east and west.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously it is in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel Staircase
rooms.description: A crude staircase has been cut into the ice, leading down into oblivion. There is a strange yellowish glow coming from the passageway below.  There is blue ice tunnel to the east leading to a T-junction.

East.description: A solid oaken door is set into a stone wall that bars passage to the east. Through a small barred window set into the door you can see a tunnel, leading east, that has been cut through the ice.

rooms.name: A Turn in the Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The floor in this section of tunnel is more even than most sections.  The ice walls continue to the west, but open up more into a large cavern made of blue ice to the south.  The floor is somewhat covered in bits of rock, which makes it less slippery than walking on plain ice.

rooms.name: A Turn in the Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: There was much care taken in the building of this tunnel.  Aside from the walls being made of ice, it would almost seem like a common passageway, rather than a tunnel.  There is some light filtering in from the north from the entrance to the caves, which also continue east of here.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel Staircase
rooms.description: This narrow passage cut through the ice opens up into a large cavern to the north.  Along the south wall a narrow staircase made of ice leads above.  It is much cooler down here than the upper levels, and for some odd reason it seems brighter.

rooms.name: Ice Cavern
rooms.description: Huge stalactites made of ice hang from the ceiling of this huge cavern. There are also large stalagmites rising from the already uneven floor, making movement even more difficult.  The strange blue light is still apparent here, and is actually quite bright.

rooms.name: Ice Cavern
rooms.description: Huge stalactites made of ice hang from the ceiling of this huge cavern. There are also large stalagmites rising from the already uneven floor, making movement even more difficult.  The strange blue light is still apparent here, and is actually bright.

rooms.name: Ice Cavern
rooms.description: Huge stalactites made of ice hang from the ceiling of this huge cavern. There are also large stalagmites rising from the already uneven floor, making movement even more difficult.  The strange blue light is still apparent here, and is actually quite bright.

rooms.name: Ice Cavern
rooms.description: Huge stalactites made of ice hang from the ceiling of this huge cavern. There are also large stalagmites rising from the already uneven floor, making movement even more difficult.  The strange blue light is still apparent here, and is actually bright.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel bends here with a wide arc, leading to the west and south into a large cavern.  It begins to become more narrow down the tunnel west, and is also somewhat circular, instead of more square and defined.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel bends here with a wide arc, leading to the north and east.  It begins to become more narrow one direction and increase in size the other. The tunnel is also somewhat circular, instead of more square and defined.

rooms.name: T-Junction in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: Three tunnels meet here, forming a T-Junction.  North is another T-Junction, leading in another direction.  To the south there is a bend in the ice tunnel, while the third tunnel leads off to the east.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnels continue east, entering into a large cavern and west to a T-junction.  They are really unremarkable here, flecked with small bits of rock and some miscolored chunks of ice.

rooms.name: White Dragon Hall
rooms.description: This is a large, circular cavern made of ice.  The floor is covered with large, flat, round marble stones.  There are long, plain white banners hanging from the ceiling.  The cavern continues east and south, and there is a tunnel west.

rooms.name: White Dragon Hall
rooms.description: This is a large, circular cavern made of ice.  The floor is covered with large, flat, round marble stones.  There are long, plain white banners hanging from the ceiling.  The cavern continues west and south, and there is a tunnel north.

rooms.name: White Dragon Hall
rooms.description: This is a large, circular cavern made of ice.  The floor is covered with large, flat, round marble stones.  There are long, plain white banners hanging from the ceiling.  The cavern continues east and north.

rooms.name: White Dragon Hall
rooms.description: This is a large, circular cavern made of ice.  The floor is covered with large, flat, round marble stones.  There are long, plain white banners hanging from the ceiling.  The cavern continues north and west.  There seems to be a faint scratch in the wall to the east, but nothing pronounced.

East.description: A wooden door reinforced with thick metal bands is set into this wall.

rooms.name: Aelfric's Hall
rooms.description: The Hall of Aelfric is long, and the walls are nicely made of polished, seemingly magical stone.  There is an exit back into a cavern to the west, or Aelfric's Hall continues to the east.

West.description: A wooden door re-enforced with thick metal bands is set into this wall.

rooms.name: A Turn in Aelfric's Hall
rooms.description: The Hall of Aelfric is long, and the walls are nicely made of polished, seemingly magical stone.  There is an exit back into a cavern far to the west, or Aelfric's Hall continues to the north.

rooms.name: A Turn in Aelfric's Hall
rooms.description: The Hall of Aelfric is long, and the walls are nicely made of polished, seemingly magical stone.  There is hallway leading back out to a cavern to the south, or the end of Aelfric's Hall is to the west.

extras.text: Strange words area carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously it is in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This narrow tunnel leads along to a bend to the west.  The walls are very uneven in this tunnel, as if it were still being constructed almost.  There is a cavern to the east.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This narrow tunnel leads along to the north and east of here.  The walls are very uneven in this tunnel, as if it were still being constructed almost.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This narrow tunnel leads along to the north and south of here.  The walls are very uneven in this tunnel, as if it were still being constructed almost.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This narrow tunnel leads along to the north and south of here.  The walls are very uneven in this tunnel, as if it were still being constructed almost.

rooms.name: The End of Aelfric's Hall
rooms.description: Aelfric's Hall comes to and end here.  The passage way leads back to the east to a corner of the hallway.  This room has some magical powers, beyond what is safe to anyone but Aelfric.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This narrow tunnel leads along to the east and south of here.  The walls are very uneven in this tunnel, as if it were still being constructed almost.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The walls are very uneven in this tunnel, as if it were still being constructed almost.  The tunnel leads east to a T-Junction and west to a bend to the south.

rooms.name: T-Junction in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: Three tunnels meet here, forming a T-Junction.  A narrowing tunnel heads north.  To the south there is yet another junction, while the third tunnel leads off to the west.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel bends here with a wide arc, leading to the south and east.  It begins to become more narrow one direction and increase in size the other. The tunnel is also somewhat circular, instead of more square and defined.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously it is in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnels continue east and west.  They are really unremarkable here, flecked with small bits of rock and some miscolored chunks of ice.  There is what looks like a door to the north.

North.description: A sturdy oaken door with a small barred window is set into this wall. Through the window you can see a hallway  which leads north.  It appears as though the hallway is made of a reddish ice.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnels continue east and west.  They are really unremarkable here, flecked with small bits of rock and some miscolored chunks of ice.

rooms.name: Bend in Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel bends here with a wide arc, leading to the south and west.  It begins to become more narrow one direction and increase in size the other. The tunnel is also somewhat circular, instead of more square and defined.

extras.text: Strange words are carved into a smooth section of the ice along this wall. They appear to read, "Vilantus Carmec Lhali."  Obviously it is in some strange language of which you are not familiar.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnels continue north and south, entering into a larger cavern.  They are really unremarkable here, flecked with small bits of rock and some miscolored chunks of ice.

rooms.name: Red Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This smooth narrow tunnel is made of red ice.  The light coming from deep within the mountain when reflected through the red ice casts and eerie blood red glow in this tunnel.  If what is told about the Dragon Cult is true, the red color could be nothing less than frozen blood.  The tunnel leads north and south from this point.

South.description: A sturdy oaken door is set into this wall.  The door has a small barred window through which you can see a narrow tunnel heading east and west.

rooms.name: Red Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: This blood covered hallway has caused trouble for past explorers.  There are two old human bodies frozen into the walls, one on the east wall, and one on the west.  It would seem that they have been here for quite some time with looks of horror frozen on their faces.  There is a larger chamber to the north, and the narrow tunnel continues on to the south.

North.description: A wooden door reinforced with metal bands is set into this wall.  A small window offers a glimpse at to what lies behind this door.  Through the window you can see what looks like some sort of temple.  There seems to be a large statue of sort against the northwest corner of the room.

rooms.name: Temple of the White Dragon
rooms.description: A huge cavern opens up to the north and east of here.  The walls are made of the same white brick as the floor is.  The ice on the ceiling is covered by what looks like frozen human blood, making the entire room glow red.  There is a giant statue in the northern part of the cavern from here, dominating the view in that direction.  There is a tunnel leading out of the Temple to the south.

South.description: Set into this wall is a sturdy wooden door which has been reinforced with metal bands.  A small window with metal bars has been placed in the door at eye height.  Through the window you can see a hallway lined with a strange red ice.

rooms.name: Temple of the White Dragon
rooms.description: A huge cavern opens up to the north and west of here.  The walls are made of the same white brick as the floor is.  The ice on the ceiling is covered by what looks like frozen human blood, making the entire room glow red.

rooms.name: Temple of the White Dragon
rooms.description: A huge cavern opens up to the south and west of here.  The walls are made of the same white brick as the floor is.  The ice on the ceiling is covered by what looks like frozen human blood, making the entire room glow red.  This is the section of the temple where the loyal gather to watch the sacrifices that no doubt take place to the west.

North.description: The small black door set into this wall stands out against the white stones that form the walls of this temple.  Thick metal bands blackened by fire help strengthen the door.

rooms.name: Altar of the White Dragon Temple
rooms.description: This section of the Temple is dominated by a huge, white marble statue of a dragon, curled around what seems to be a sacrificial altar.  The altar is raised on a small dais which is reached by a short flight of stairs.  There are white banners hanging from either side of the altar, from the ceiling.  Each banner has the bloody red dragon's claw drawn on them.

rooms.name: Temple Staircase
rooms.description: It is immediately apparent that this narrow staircase made of dull ice leads down into the dragon's lair.  There is a horrid look around, as the walls are covered in blood.  The staircase below is made so that the slightest disturbance will alert anything around to the presence of what, or who, disturbed it.

South.description: A small black door strengthened by blackened metal bands stands before you blocking your passage.

rooms.name: White Dragon Lair
rooms.description: This cavern is absolutely massive.  The ceiling overhead is far higher than any other around.  The chamber is littered with decaying flesh and bits of bone, gnawed on by what is unknown.  There is also armor everywhere, mingled with destroyed weapons and shields.  There is a small staircase leading back up against the southern wall, offering an escape from this place.

rooms.name: White Dragon Lair
rooms.description: This massive cavern is shaped oddly in this section.  Piles of broken weapons and armor start to the west, continuing on in that direction.  The walls and ceiling are shorter here than other places, but still dozens of feet tall.

rooms.name: White Dragon Lair
rooms.description: The remains of various creatures are piled into this corner of the cavern. The bodies and weapons are strewn all about, heading to the south.

rooms.name: White Dragon Lair
rooms.description: This is an immense section of the Dragon's Lair.  The ceiling above is barely visible for how high above it is.  The floor is cleared off with a few, rare exceptions.  This center-piece of the cavern is visible from nearly every other part of the cave, but to the north is more dim.

extras.text: The writings are of a language and alphabet completely foreign to you.

rooms.name: White Dragon Lair
rooms.description: There is little other than bits of former humanoids scattered about here. Some might have just been stupid beast, but some of the arms and legs are, though skinned, obviously human.

rooms.name: White Dragon Lair
rooms.description: There is little other than bits of former humanoids scattered about here. Some might have just been stupid beast, but some of the arms and legs are, though skinned, obviously human.

rooms.name: White Dragon Lair
rooms.description: The ceiling of this section of cavern is much higher than elsewhere.  It is literally hundreds of feet in height.  A large pool of ice cold water lies in the northeast corner, and is fed by a small stream flowing in from a crack in the east wall.  Otherwise, the ground is barren, and for good reason.  The cavern continues south and west.
